Maybe if someone had some spare time, perhaps Al coz he's good at libraries, could code a library maker.

You would enter the custom options, commands, and whatever else libraries add (i'm no hotshot), then the library maker would output the file!  You would also be able to save and load your library settings if you know what I mean.

Matthew G.

hahaha, I've gotta remember that one. "Little fishermen". . . Right, noted.

Anyway, nope, bad idea since it's basically the same as normal ASL code. You just make small changes to the file.

That said however - my ASL editor will have things for Library creators (like version info, cretaor, etc... Then "!addto game" and "!QDK" etc...).
